title: How did men and women dress in ancient Greece? - Quora

response.answer_text: The most common article was the folded and pinned skirt called the Chiton. It came in both long  and short, depending on the folds-men wore them shorter on average For active men and Spartan women, there was the Exomis  The common women’s dress was the Peplos  The equivalent of the jacket or overcoat was the Himation, wrapped or drapped over the chiton or main garment  Another cloak was the chlamys, sometimes worn by the youngest and poorest as their only garment  Undergarments were rare, but athletes did wear them. The loincloth was called the Perizoma  Instead of a brassiere, the bust would be supported by a belt called the strophion https://www.metmuseum.org/toah/hd/grdr/hd_grdr.htm Ancient Greek fashion history.
